api/KYS.Library.Helpers.EmailHelper.Smtp.title: Class EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig | KYS.Library
api/KYS.Library.Helpers.EmailHelper.Smtp.summary: Class EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig Namespace KYS.Library.Helpers Assembly KYS.Library.dll Represents the configuration settings required to initialize and send emails using an SMTP client. public class EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig Inheritance object EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This class encapsulates SMTP configuration options such as host, port, credentials, and SSL settings. It also provides an implicit conversion to SmtpClient for convenient use. Example usage: var smtpConfig = new SmtpClientConfig( host: "smtp.gmail.com", port: 587, senderEmail: "example@gmail.com", senderPassword: "password", enableSSL: true); using var smtpClient = (SmtpClient)smtpConfig; smtpClient.Send("example@gmail.com", "recipient@example.com", "Subject", "Body"); Constructors SmtpClientConfig(string, int, string, string, bool, bool) Initializes a new instance of the EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig class with the specified SMTP server settings and credentials. public SmtpClientConfig(string host, int port, string senderEmail, string senderPassword, bool enableSSL = false, bool useDefaultCredentials = false) Parameters host string The host URL of the SMTP server. port int The port number used for the SMTP connection. senderEmail string The email address of the sender. senderPassword string The password associated with the sender’s email account. enableSSL bool Optional. If true, enables SSL encryption for the SMTP connection. Default is false. useDefaultCredentials bool Optional. If true, uses the system’s default credentials instead of the provided credentials. Default is false. Properties EnableSSL Gets or sets a value indicating whether SSL encryption should be enabled for the SMTP connection. public bool EnableSSL { get; set; } Property Value bool Host Gets or sets a string value for the host URL for the SMTP server. public string Host { get; set; } Property Value string Port Gets or sets a int value for the port number for the the SMTP server. public int Port { get; set; } Property Value int SenderEmail Gets or sets a string value for the sender's email address. public string SenderEmail { get; set; } Property Value string SenderPassword Gets or sets a string value for the sender's email password. public string SenderPassword { get; set; } Property Value string UseDefaultCredentials Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use the system’s default credentials when authenticating with the SMTP server. public bool UseDefaultCredentials { get; set; } Property Value bool Operators implicit operator SmtpClient(SmtpClientConfig) Implicitly converts an instance of EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig to a configured instance of SmtpClient. public static implicit operator SmtpClient(EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig smtpClientConfig) Parameters smtpClientConfig EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig The EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig instance containing SMTP configuration settings. Returns SmtpClient A configured SmtpClient instance. Remarks This allows seamless casting from EmailHelper.SmtpClientConfig to SmtpClient: var smtpConfig = new SmtpClientConfig("smtp.gmail.com", 587, "user@gmail.com", "password", true); using var smtpClient = (SmtpClient)smtpConfig;

index.html.title: KYS.Library Documentation | KYS.Library
index.html.summary: KYS.Library Documentation Welcome to KYS.Library, a modular utility library built for internal .NET applications. It provides reusable helpers, extensions, services, and validation tools to reduce repeated code and improve application consistency. This site contains a high-level overview of the library and a full API reference automatically generated from XML documentation comments. 📦 Project Modules KYS.Library.Extensions Provides extension methods that enhance built-in .NET types, making everyday code more expressive and easier to read. KYS.Library.Helpers Includes helper classes focused on simplifying repetitive or boilerplate tasks such as parsing, conversions, or calculations. KYS.Library.Services Contains reusable service-style components that encapsulate common operations or shared logic used across applications. KYS.Library.Validations Offers a collection of validation utilities used to enforce consistent input checks and data validation rules. 🚀 Using This Library (Internal Use) Since this library is not currently published to NuGet, it can be consumed by: Cloning or downloading the repository Building the solution Locating the generated DLLs under: KYS.Library/bin/Debug/net8.0/ or KYS.Library/bin/Release/net8.0/ Adding the DLL references to your project manually: In Visual Studio: Project → Add Reference → Browse → Select DLLs In .NET CLI-based project: <ItemGroup> <Reference Include="KYS.Library"> <HintPath>path/to/KYS.Library.dll</HintPath> </Reference> </ItemGroup> 📘 API Reference Detailed class, method, and property documentation is available under the API section of this site. All content is generated automatically based on XML documentation comments in the source code. 📂 Project Structure KYS.Library/ ├── KYS.Library.Services/ ├── KYS.Library.Extensions/ ├── KYS.Library.Helpers/ └── KYS.Library.Validations/ (Classes and namespaces inside each module can be viewed through the API reference.) 🛠 Documentation This documentation is generated using DocFX and will stay updated as new XML comments are added or modified.
